segment_text: I set out to discover what is skillful, seeking the supreme state of sublime peace. Traveling stage by stage in the Magadhan lands, I arrived at the town of Senā in Uruvelā.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: There I saw a delightful park, a lovely grove with a flowing river that was clean and charming, with smooth banks. And nearby was a village to resort to for alms.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: Then it occurred to me,
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: ‘This park is truly delightful, a lovely grove with a flowing river that’s clean and charming, with smooth banks. And nearby there’s a village to resort to for alms.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: This is good enough for striving for a gentleman wanting to strive.’
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: So I sat down right there, thinking,
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: ‘This is good enough for striving.’
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: And then these three similes, which were neither supernaturally inspired, nor learned before in the past, occurred to me.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: Suppose there was a green, sappy log, and it was lying in water.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: Then a person comes along with a drill-stick, thinking
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: to light a fire and produce heat.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: What do you think, Prince?

segment_text: Then some deities saw me and said,
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: ‘The ascetic Gotama is dead.’
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: Others said,
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: ‘He’s not dead, but he’s dying.’
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: Others said,
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: ‘He’s not dead or dying. The ascetic Gotama is a perfected one, for that is how the perfected ones live.’
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: Then it occurred to me,
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: ‘Why don’t I practice completely cutting off food?’
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: But deities came to me and said,
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: ‘Good fellow, don’t practice totally cutting off food.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: If you do, we’ll infuse heavenly nectar into your pores and you will live on that.’
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: Then it occurred to me,
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: ‘If I claim to be completely fasting while these deities are infusing heavenly nectar in my pores, that would be a lie on my part.’
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: So I dismissed those deities, saying, ‘There’s no need.’
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: Then it occurred to me,
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: ‘Why don’t I just take a little bit of food each time, a handful of broth made from mung beans, horse gram, chickpeas, or green gram?’
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: So that’s what I did,
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: until my body became extremely emaciated.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: Due to eating so little, my major and minor limbs became like the joints of an eighty-year-old or a dying man,
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: my bottom became like a camel’s hoof,
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: my vertebrae stuck out like beads on a string,
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: and my ribs were as gaunt as the broken-down rafters on an old barn.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: Due to eating so little, the gleam of my eyes sank deep in their sockets, like the gleam of water sunk deep down a well.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: Due to eating so little, my scalp shriveled and withered like a green bitter-gourd in the wind and sun.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: Due to eating so little, the skin of my belly stuck to my backbone, so that when I tried to rub the skin of my belly I grabbed my backbone, and when I tried to rub my backbone I rubbed the skin of my belly.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: Due to eating so little, when I tried to urinate or defecate I fell face down right there.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: Due to eating so little, when I tried to relieve my body by rubbing my limbs with my hands, the hair, rotted at its roots, fell out.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: Then some people saw me and said, ‘The ascetic Gotama is black.’
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: Some said, ‘He’s not black, he’s brown.’
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: Some said, ‘He’s neither black nor brown. The ascetic Gotama has tawny skin.’
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: That’s how far the pure, bright complexion of my skin had been ruined by taking so little food.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: Then it occurred to me,
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: ‘Whatever ascetics and brahmins have experienced painful, sharp, severe, acute feelings due to overexertion—whether in the past, future, or present—this is as far as it goes, no-one has done more than this.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: But I have not achieved any superhuman distinction in knowledge and vision worthy of the noble ones by this severe, gruelling work.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: Could there be another path to awakening?’
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: Then it occurred to me,
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: ‘I recall sitting in the cool shade of a black plum tree while my father the Sakyan was off working. Quite secluded from sensual pleasures, secluded from unskillful qualities, I entered and remained in the first absorption, which has the rapture and bliss born of seclusion, while placing the mind and keeping it connected.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: Could that be the path to awakening?’
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: Stemming from that memory came the understanding:
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: ‘*That* is the path to awakening!’
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: Then it occurred to me,
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: ‘Why am I afraid of that pleasure, for it has nothing to do with sensual pleasures or unskillful qualities?’
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: Then it occurred to me,
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: ‘I’m not afraid of that pleasure, for it has nothing to do with sensual pleasures or unskillful qualities.’
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: Then it occurred to me,
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: ‘I can’t achieve that pleasure with a body so excessively emaciated. Why don’t I eat some solid food, some rice and porridge?’
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: So I ate some solid food.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: Now at that time the group of five mendicants were attending on me, thinking,
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: ‘The ascetic Gotama will tell us of any truth that he realizes.’
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: But when I ate some solid food, they left disappointed in me, saying,
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: ‘The ascetic Gotama has become indulgent; he has strayed from the struggle and returned to indulgence.’
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: After eating solid food and gathering my strength, quite secluded from sensual pleasures, secluded from unskillful qualities, I entered and remained in the first absorption …
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: second absorption …
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: third absorption …
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: fourth absorption.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: When my mind had immersed in samādhi like this—purified, bright, flawless, rid of corruptions, pliable, workable, steady, and imperturbable—I extended it toward recollection of past lives.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: I recollected many past lives. That is: one, two, three, four, five, ten, twenty, thirty, forty, fifty, a hundred, a thousand, a hundred thousand rebirths; many eons of the world contracting, many eons of the world expanding, many eons of the world contracting and expanding. And so I recollected my many kinds of past lives, with features and details.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: This was the first knowledge, which I achieved in the first watch of the night.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: Ignorance was destroyed and knowledge arose; darkness was destroyed and light arose, as happens for a meditator who is diligent, keen, and resolute.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: When my mind had immersed in samādhi like this—purified, bright, flawless, rid of corruptions, pliable, workable, steady, and imperturbable—I extended it toward knowledge of the death and rebirth of sentient beings.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: With clairvoyance that is purified and superhuman, I saw sentient beings passing away and being reborn—inferior and superior, beautiful and ugly, in a good place or a bad place. I understood how sentient beings are reborn according to their deeds.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: This was the second knowledge, which I achieved in the middle watch of the night. Ignorance was destroyed and knowledge arose; darkness was destroyed and light arose, as happens for a meditator who is diligent, keen, and resolute.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: When my mind had immersed in samādhi like this—purified, bright, flawless, rid of corruptions, pliable, workable, steady, and imperturbable—I extended it toward knowledge of the ending of defilements.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: I truly understood: ‘This is suffering’ … ‘This is the origin of suffering’ … ‘This is the cessation of suffering’ … ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering’.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: I truly understood: ‘These are defilements’ … ‘This is the origin of defilements’ … ‘This is the cessation of defilements’ … ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of defilements’.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: Knowing and seeing like this, my mind was freed from the defilements of sensuality, desire to be reborn, and ignorance.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: When it was freed, I knew it was freed.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: I understood: ‘Rebirth is ended; the spiritual journey has been completed; what had to be done has been done; there is nothing further for this place.’
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: This was the third knowledge, which I achieved in the last watch of the night.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: Ignorance was destroyed and knowledge arose; darkness was destroyed and light arose, as happens for a meditator who is diligent, keen, and resolute.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: Then it occurred to me,
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: ‘This principle I have discovered is deep, hard to see, hard to understand, peaceful, sublime, beyond the scope of logic, subtle, comprehensible to the astute.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: But people like clinging, they love it and enjoy it.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: It’s hard for them to see this topic; that is, specific conditionality, dependent origination.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: It’s also hard for them to see this topic; that is, the stilling of all activities, the letting go of all attachments, the ending of craving, fading away, cessation, extinguishment.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: And if I were to teach this principle, others might not understand me, which would be wearying and troublesome for me.’
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: And then these verses, which were neither supernaturally inspired, nor learned before in the past, occurred to me:
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: ‘I’ve struggled hard to realize this,
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: enough with trying to explain it!
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: Those mired in greed and hate
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: can’t really understand this teaching.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: It goes against the stream, subtle,
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: deep, obscure, and very fine.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: Those besotted by greed cannot see,
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: for they’re shrouded in a mass of darkness.’
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: And as I reflected like this, my mind inclined to remaining passive, not to teaching the Dhamma.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: Then the divinity Sahampati, knowing my train of thought, thought,
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: ‘Oh lord! The world will be lost, the world will perish! For the mind of the Realized One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha, inclines to remaining passive, not to teaching the Dhamma.’
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: Then the divinity Sahampati, as easily as a strong person would extend or contract their arm, vanished from the realm of divinity and reappeared in front of me.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: He arranged his robe over one shoulder, raised his joined palms toward me, and said,
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: ‘Sir, let the Blessed One teach the Dhamma! Let the Holy One teach the Dhamma!
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: There are beings with little dust in their eyes. They’re in decline because they haven’t heard the teaching.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: There will be those who understand the teaching!’
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: That’s what the divinity Sahampati said.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: Then he went on to say:
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: ‘Among the Magadhans there appeared in the past
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: an impure teaching thought up by the stained.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: Fling open the door to freedom from death!
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: Let them hear the teaching <j>the immaculate one discovered.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: Standing high on a rocky mountain,
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: you can see the people all around.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: In just the same way, All-seer, so intelligent,
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: having ascended the Temple of Truth,
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: rid of sorrow, look upon the people
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: swamped with sorrow,  <j>oppressed by rebirth and old age.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: Rise, hero! Victor in battle, leader of the caravan,
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: wander the world free of debt.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: Let the Blessed One teach the Dhamma!
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: There will be those who understand!’
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: Then, understanding the Divinity’s invitation, I surveyed the world with the eye of a Buddha, because of my compassion for sentient beings.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: And I saw sentient beings with little dust in their eyes, and some with much dust in their eyes; with keen faculties and with weak faculties, with good qualities and with bad qualities, easy to teach and hard to teach. And some of them lived seeing the danger in the fault to do with the next world, while others did not.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: It’s like a pool with blue water lilies, or pink or white lotuses. Some of them sprout and grow in the water without rising above it, thriving underwater. Some of them sprout and grow in the water reaching the water’s surface. And some of them sprout and grow in the water but rise up above the water and stand with no water clinging to them.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: Then I replied in verse to the divinity Sahampati:
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: ‘Flung open are the doors to freedom from death!
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: Let those with ears to hear commit to faith.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: Thinking it would be troublesome, Divinity, <j>I did not teach
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: the sophisticated, sublime Dhamma among mankind.’
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: Then the divinity Sahampati, knowing that his request for me to teach the Dhamma had been granted, bowed and respectfully circled me, keeping me on his right, before vanishing right there.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: Then it occurred to me,
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: ‘Who should I teach first of all?
title: With Prince Bodhi

title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: Then it occurred to me,
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: ‘That Āḷāra Kālāma is astute, competent, clever, and has long had little dust in his eyes.
title: With Prince Bodhi

title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: He’ll quickly understand the teaching.’
title: With Prince Bodhi

title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: ‘Sir, Āḷāra Kālāma passed away seven days ago.’
title: With Prince Bodhi

title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: ‘Āḷāra Kālāma passed away seven days ago.’
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: Then it occurred to me,
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: ‘This is a great loss for Āḷāra Kālāma.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: If he had heard the teaching, he would have understood it quickly.’
title: With Prince Bodhi

title: With Prince Bodhi

title: With Prince Bodhi

title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: ‘This is a great loss for Uddaka.

title: With Prince Bodhi

title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: ‘The group of five mendicants were very helpful to me. They looked after me during my time of resolute striving.
title: With Prince Bodhi

title: With Prince Bodhi

title: With Prince Bodhi

title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: With clairvoyance that is purified and superhuman I saw that the group of five mendicants were staying near Varanasi, in the deer park at Isipatana.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: So, when I had stayed in Uruvelā as long as I pleased, I set out for Varanasi.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: While I was traveling along the road between Gayā and Bodhgaya, the Ājīvaka ascetic Upaka saw me
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: and said,
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: ‘Reverend, your faculties are so very clear, and your complexion is pure and bright.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: In whose name have you gone forth, reverend? Who is your Teacher? Whose teaching do you believe in?’
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: I replied to Upaka in verse:
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: ‘I am the champion, the knower of all,
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: unsullied in the midst of all things.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: I’ve given up all, freed in the ending of craving.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: Since I know for myself, whose follower should I be?
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: I have no tutor.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: There is no-one like me.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: In the world with its gods,
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: I have no rival.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: For in this world, I am the perfected one;
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: I am the supreme Teacher.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: I alone am fully awakened,
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: cooled, quenched.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: I am going to the city of Kāsi
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: to roll forth the Wheel of Dhamma.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: In this world that is so blind,
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: I’ll beat the drum of freedom from death!’
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: ‘According to what you claim, reverend, you ought to be the Infinite Victor.’
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: ‘The victors are those who, like me,
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: have reached the ending of defilements.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: I have conquered bad qualities, Upaka—
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: that’s why I’m a victor.’
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: When I had spoken, Upaka said: ‘If you say so, reverend.’ Shaking his head, he took a wrong turn and left.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: Traveling stage by stage, I arrived at Varanasi, and went to see the group of five mendicants in the deer park at Isipatana.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: The group of five mendicants saw me coming off in the distance
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: and stopped each other, saying,
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: ‘Here comes the ascetic Gotama. He’s so indulgent; he strayed from the struggle and returned to indulgence.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: We shouldn’t bow to him or rise for him or receive his bowl and robe.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: But we can set out a seat; he can sit if he likes.’
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: Yet as I drew closer, the group of five mendicants were unable to stop themselves as they had agreed.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: Some came out to greet me and receive my bowl and robe, some spread out a seat, while others set out water for washing my feet.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: But they still addressed me by name and as ‘reverend’.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: So I said to them,
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: ‘Mendicants, don’t address me by name and as “reverend”.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: The Realized One is Perfected, a fully awakened Buddha.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: Listen up, mendicants: I have achieved freedom from death! I shall instruct you, I will teach you the Dhamma.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: By practicing as instructed you will soon realize the supreme end of the spiritual path in this very life. You will live having achieved with your own insight the goal for which gentlemen rightly go forth from the lay life to homelessness.’
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: But they said to me,
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: ‘Reverend Gotama, even by that conduct, that practice, that grueling work you did not achieve any superhuman distinction in knowledge and vision worthy of the noble ones. How could you have achieved such a state now that you’ve become indulgent, strayed from the struggle and fallen into indulgence?’
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: So I said to them,
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: ‘The Realized One has not become indulgent, strayed from the struggle and fallen into indulgence.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: The Realized One is Perfected, a fully awakened Buddha.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: Listen up, mendicants: I have achieved freedom from death! I shall instruct you, I will teach you the Dhamma.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: By practicing as instructed you will soon realize the supreme end of the spiritual path in this very life. You will live having achieved with your own insight the goal for which gentlemen rightly go forth from the lay life to homelessness.’
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: But for a second time they said to me,
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: ‘Reverend Gotama … you’ve fallen into indulgence.’
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: So for a second time I said to them,
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: ‘The Realized One has not become indulgent …’
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: But for a third time they said to me,
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: ‘Reverend Gotama … you’ve fallen into indulgence.’
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: So I said to them,
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: ‘Mendicants, have you ever known me to speak like this before?’
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: ‘No, sir.’
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: ‘The Realized One is Perfected, a fully awakened Buddha.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: Listen up, mendicants: I have achieved freedom from death! I shall instruct you, I will teach you the Dhamma.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: By practicing as instructed you will soon realize the supreme end of the spiritual path in this very life. You will live having achieved with your own insight the goal for which gentlemen rightly go forth from the lay life to homelessness.’
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: I was able to persuade the group of five mendicants.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: Then sometimes I advised two mendicants, while the other three went for alms.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: Then those three would feed all six of us with what they brought back.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: Sometimes I advised three mendicants, while the other two went for alms.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: Then those two would feed all six of us with what they brought back.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: As the group of five mendicants were being advised and instructed by me like this, they soon realized the supreme end of the spiritual path in this very life. They lived having achieved with their own insight the goal for which gentlemen rightly go forth from the lay life to homelessness.”
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: When he had spoken, Prince Bodhi said to the Buddha,
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: “Sir, when a mendicant has the Realized One as trainer, how long would it take for them to realize the supreme end of the spiritual path in this very life?”
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: “Well then, prince, I’ll ask you about this in return, and you can answer as you like.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: What do you think, prince?
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: Are you skilled in the art of wielding a hooked goad while riding an elephant?”
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: “Yes, sir.”
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: “What do you think, prince?
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: Suppose a man were to come along thinking,
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: ‘Prince Bodhi knows the art of wielding a hooked goad while riding an elephant.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: I’ll train in that art under him.’
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: If he’s faithless,
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: he wouldn’t achieve what he could with faith.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: If he’s unhealthy,
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: he wouldn’t achieve what he could with good health.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: If he’s devious or deceitful,
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: he wouldn’t achieve what he could with honesty and integrity.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: If he’s lazy,
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: he wouldn’t achieve what he could with energy.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: If he’s stupid,
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: he wouldn’t achieve what he could with wisdom.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: What do you think, prince?
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: Could that man still train under you in the art of wielding a hooked goad while riding an elephant?”
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: “Sir, if he had even a single one of these factors he couldn’t train under me, let alone all five.”
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: “What do you think, prince?
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: Suppose a man were to come along thinking,
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: ‘Prince Bodhi knows the art of wielding a hooked goad while riding an elephant.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: I’ll train in that art under him.’
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: If he’s faithful,
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: he’d achieve what he could with faith.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: If he’s healthy,
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: he’d achieve what he could with good health.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: If he’s honest and has integrity,
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: he’d achieve what he could with honesty and integrity.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: If he’s energetic,
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: he’d achieve what he could with energy.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: If he’s wise,
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: he’d achieve what he could with wisdom.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: What do you think, prince?
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: Could that man still train under you in the art of wielding a hooked goad while riding an elephant?”
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: “Sir, if he had even a single one of these factors he could train under me, let alone all five.”
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: “In the same way, prince, there are these five factors that support meditation.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: What five?
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: It’s when a noble disciple has faith in the Realized One’s awakening:
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: ‘That Blessed One is perfected, a fully awakened Buddha, accomplished in knowledge and conduct, holy, knower of the world, supreme guide for those who wish to train, teacher of gods and humans, awakened, blessed.’
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: They are rarely ill or unwell. Their stomach digests well, being neither too hot nor too cold, but just right, and fit for meditation.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: They’re not devious or deceitful. They reveal themselves honestly to the Teacher or sensible spiritual companions.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: They live with energy roused up for giving up unskillful qualities and embracing skillful qualities. They’re strong, staunchly vigorous, not slacking off when it comes to developing skillful qualities.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: They’re wise. They have the wisdom of arising and passing away which is noble, penetrative, and leads to the complete ending of suffering.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: These are the five factors that support meditation.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: When a mendicant with these five factors that support meditation has the Realized One as trainer, they could
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: realize the supreme end of the spiritual path in seven years.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: Let alone seven years,
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: they could
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: realize the supreme end of the spiritual path in six years,
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: or as little as one year.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: Let alone one year,
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: when a mendicant with these five factors that support meditation has the Realized One as trainer, they could
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: realize the supreme end of the spiritual path in seven months,
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: or as little as one day.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: Let alone one day,
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: when a mendicant with these five factors that support meditation has the Realized One as trainer, they could be instructed In the evening and achieve distinction in the morning, or be instructed in the morning and achieve distinction in the evening.”
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: When he had spoken, Prince Bodhi said to the Buddha,
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: “Oh, the Buddha! Oh, the teaching! Oh, how well explained is the teaching!
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: For someone could be instructed in the evening and achieve distinction in the morning, or be instructed in the morning and achieve distinction in the evening.”
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: When he said this, Sañjikāputta said to Prince Bodhi,
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: “Though the worthy Bodhi speaks like this,
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: you don’t go for refuge to the worthy Gotama, to the teaching, and to the mendicant Saṅgha.”
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: “Don’t say that, dear Sañjikāputta, don’t say that!
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: I have heard and learned this in the presence of my lady mother.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: This one time the Buddha was staying near Kosambī, in Ghosita’s Monastery.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: Then my pregnant lady mother went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and said to him,
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: ‘Sir, the prince or princess in my womb goes for refuge to the Buddha, the teaching, and the mendicant Saṅgha.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: From this day forth, may the Buddha remember them as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life.’
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: Another time the Buddha was staying here in the land of the Bhaggas at Crocodile Hill, in the deer park at Bhesakaḷā’s Wood.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: Then my nursemaid, carrying me on her hip, went to the Buddha, bowed, stood to one side, and said to him,
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: ‘Sir, this Prince Bodhi goes for refuge to the Buddha, to the teaching, and to the mendicant Saṅgha.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: From this day forth, may the Buddha remember him as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life.’
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: Now for a third time I go for refuge to the Buddha, to the teaching, and to the mendicant Saṅgha.
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: From this day forth, may the Buddha remember me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life.”
title: With Prince Bodhi

segment_text: So I have heard.
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: Now at that time in the realm of King Pasenadi of Kosala there was a bandit named Aṅgulimāla. He was violent, bloody-handed, a hardened killer, merciless to living beings.
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: He laid waste to villages, towns, and countries.
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: He was constantly murdering humans, and he wore their fingers as a necklace.
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: Then the Buddha robed up in the morning and, taking his bowl and robe, entered Sāvatthī for alms.
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: Then, after the meal, on his return from almsround, he set his lodgings in order and, taking his bowl and robe, he walked down the road that led to Aṅgulimāla.
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: The cowherds, shepherds, farmers, and travelers saw him on the road,
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: and said to him,
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: “Don’t take this road, ascetic.
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: On this road there is a bandit named Aṅgulimāla. He is violent, bloody-handed, a hardened killer, merciless to living beings.
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: He has laid waste to villages, towns, and countries.
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: He is constantly murdering humans, and he wears their fingers as a necklace.
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: People travel along this road only after banding closely together in groups of ten, twenty, thirty, forty, or fifty.
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: Still they meet their end by Aṅgulimāla’s hand.”
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: But when they said this, the Buddha went on in silence.
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: For a second time …
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: and a third time, they urged the Buddha to turn back.
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: But when they said this, the Buddha went on in silence.
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: The bandit Aṅgulimāla saw the Buddha coming off in the distance,
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: and thought,
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: “Oh lord, how incredible, how amazing!
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: People travel along this road only after banding closely together in groups of ten, twenty, thirty, forty, or fifty.
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: Still they meet their end by my hand.
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: But still this ascetic comes along alone and unaccompanied, like a conqueror.
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: Why don’t I take his life?”
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: Then Aṅgulimāla donned his sword and shield, fastened his bow and arrows, and followed behind the Buddha.
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: But the Buddha used his psychic power to will that Aṅgulimāla could not catch up with him no matter how hard he tried, even though the Buddha kept walking at a normal speed.
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: Then Aṅgulimāla thought,
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: “Oh lord, how incredible, how amazing!
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: Previously, even when I’ve chased a speeding elephant, horse, chariot or deer, I’ve always caught up with them.
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: But I can’t catch up with this ascetic no matter how hard I try, even though he’s walking at a normal speed.”
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: He stood still and said,
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: “Stop, stop, ascetic!”
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: “I’ve stopped, Aṅgulimāla—now you stop.”
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: Then Aṅgulimāla thought,
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: “These ascetics who follow the Sakyan speak the truth.
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: Yet while walking the ascetic Gotama says:
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: ‘I’ve stopped, Aṅgulimāla—now you stop.’
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: Why don’t I ask him about this?”
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: Then he addressed the Buddha in verse:
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: “While walking, ascetic, you say ‘I’ve stopped.’
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: And I have stopped, but you tell me I’ve not.
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: I’m asking you this, ascetic:
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: how is it you’ve stopped and I have not?”
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: “Aṅgulimāla, I have forever stopped—
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: I’ve laid aside violence towards all creatures.
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: But you can’t stop yourself <j>from harming living creatures;
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: that’s why I’ve stopped, but you have not.”
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: “Oh, at long last a renowned great seer,
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: an ascetic has followed me into this deep wood.
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: Now that I’ve heard your verse on Dhamma,
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: I shall live without evil.”
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: With these words, <j>the bandit hurled his sword and weapons
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: down a cliff into an abyss.
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: He venerated the Holy One’s feet,
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: and asked him for the going forth right away.
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: Then the Buddha, the compassionate great seer,
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: the teacher of the world with its gods,
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: said to him, “Come, monk!”
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: And with that he became a monk.
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: Then the Buddha set out for Sāvatthī with Venerable Aṅgulimāla as his second monk.
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: Traveling stage by stage, he arrived at Sāvatthī,
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: where he stayed in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: Now at that time a crowd had gathered by the gate of King Pasenadi’s royal compound making a dreadful racket,
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: “In your realm, Your Majesty, there is a bandit named Aṅgulimāla. He is violent, bloody-handed, a hardened killer, merciless to living beings.
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: He has laid waste to villages, towns, and countries.
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: He is constantly murdering humans, and he wears their fingers as a necklace.
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: Your Majesty must put a stop to him!”
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: Then King Pasenadi drove out from Sāvatthī in the middle of the day with around five hundred horses,
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: heading for the monastery.
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: He went by carriage as far as the terrain allowed, then descended and approached the Buddha on foot. He bowed and sat down to one side. The Buddha said to him,
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: “What is it, great king? Is King Seniya Bimbisāra of Magadha angry with you, or the Licchavis of Vesālī, or some other opposing ruler?”
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: “No, sir.
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: In my realm there is a bandit named Aṅgulimāla. He is violent, bloody-handed, a hardened killer, merciless to living beings. …
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: I shall put a stop to him.”
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: “But great king, suppose you were to see that Aṅgulimāla had shaved off his hair and beard, dressed in ocher robes, and gone forth from the lay life to homelessness. And that he was refraining from killing living creatures, stealing, and lying; that he was eating in one part of the day, and was chaste, ethical, and of good character. What would you do to him?”
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: “I would bow to him, rise in his presence, or offer him a seat. I’d invite him to accept robes, almsfood, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick. And I’d organize his lawful guarding and protection.
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: But sir, how could such an immoral, evil man ever have such virtue and restraint?”
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: Now at that time Venerable Aṅgulimāla was sitting not far from the Buddha.
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: Then the Buddha pointed with his right arm and said to the king,
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: “Great king, this is Aṅgulimāla.”
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: Then the king became frightened, scared, his hair standing on end.
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: Knowing this, the Buddha said to him,
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: “Do not fear, great king. You have nothing to fear from him.”
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: Then the king’s fear died down.
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: Then the king went over to Aṅgulimāla and said,
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: “Sir, is the master really Aṅgulimāla?”
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: “Yes, great king.”
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: “What clans were your father and mother from?”
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: “My father was a Gagga, and my mother a Mantāṇī.”
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: “Sir, may Master Gagga son of Mantāṇī be happy.
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: I’ll make sure that you’re provided with robes, almsfood, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick.”
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: But at that time Venerable Aṅgulimāla lived in the wilderness, ate only almsfood, and owned just three robes.
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: So he said to the king,
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: “Enough, great king. My robes are complete.”
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: Then the king went back to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and said to him,
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: “It’s incredible, sir, it’s amazing!
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: How the Buddha tames those who are wild, pacifies those who are violent, and extinguishes those who are unquenched!
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: For I was not able to tame him with the rod and the sword, but the Buddha tamed him without rod or sword.
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: Well, now, sir, I must go.
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: I have many duties, and much to do.”
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: “Please, great king, go at your convenience.”
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: Then King Pasenadi got up from his seat, bowed, and respectfully circled the Buddha, keeping him on his right, before leaving.
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: Then Venerable Aṅgulimāla robed up in the morning and, taking his bowl and robe, entered Sāvatthī for alms.
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: Then as he was wandering indiscriminately for almsfood he saw a woman undergoing a distressing obstructed labor.
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: Seeing this, it occurred to him,
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: “Oh, beings undergo such travail!
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: Oh, beings undergo such travail!”
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: Then after wandering for alms in Sāvatthī, after the meal, on his return from almsround, he went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and told him what had happened. The Buddha said to him,
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: “Well then, Aṅgulimāla, go to that woman and say this:
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: ‘Ever since I was born, sister, I don’t recall having intentionally taken the life of a living creature. By this truth, may both you and your baby be safe.’”
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: “But sir, wouldn’t that be telling a deliberate lie?
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: For I have intentionally killed many living creatures.”
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: “In that case, Aṅgulimāla, go to that woman and say this:
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: ‘Ever since I was born in the noble birth, sister, I don’t recall having intentionally taken the life of a living creature. By this truth, may both you and your baby be safe.’”
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: “Yes, sir,” replied Aṅgulimāla. He went to that woman and said:
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: “Ever since I was born in the noble birth, sister, I don’t recall having intentionally taken the life of a living creature. By this truth, may both you and your baby be safe.”
title: With Aṅgulimāla

segment_text: Then that woman was safe, and so was her baby.
title: With Aṅgulimāla
